snippet: Top Republicans who worry that Mr. Trump’s increasingly plausible nomination could result in a sweeping electoral defeat also express a reluctance to take him on.
abstract: Number of leading Republican officials, strategists and donors express concern that Donald J Trump's nomination for president would lead to sound defeat and unravel gains GOP has made in recent congressional, state and local elections; strong disagreement has developed within party over whether to attempt to push Trump out of race and risk even more damaging public feud.
lead_paragraph: Top Republicans who worry that Mr. Trump’s increasingly plausible nomination could result in a sweeping electoral defeat also express a reluctance to take him on.

headline.main: Wary of Donald Trump, G.O.P. Leaders Are Caught in a Standoff
headline.print_headline: As Trump Barrels On, His Party Is Paralyzed
